messages.text:
*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=b4a91b693374 ***

weekly.2011-11-18

R=golang-dev, dsymonds, r
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5416045

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

http://codereview.appspot.com/5416045/diff/1/doc/devel/weekly.html
File doc/devel/weekly.html (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5416045/diff/1/doc/devel/weekly.html#newcode28
doc/devel/weekly.html:28: their APIs. In general, we trust programmers not to do silly things like *x =
I think from "In general, ..." to the end of this paragraph could be deleted. I don't think the weekly notes need this level of editorialising or justification.

http://codereview.appspot.com/5416045/diff/1/doc/devel/weekly.html#newcode44
doc/devel/weekly.html:44: * doc/install: add openbsd (thanks Joel Sing!).
intentional "!"?

http://codereview.appspot.com/5416045/diff/1/doc/devel/weekly.html#newcode85
doc/devel/weekly.html:85: use t.Errorf from alternate goroutine in test.
remove this line. It was a stupid bug on my part when I did the previous line.

LGTM

http://codereview.appspot.com/5416045/diff/1/doc/devel/weekly.html
File doc/devel/weekly.html (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5416045/diff/1/doc/devel/weekly.html#newcode28
doc/devel/weekly.html:28: their APIs. In general, we trust programmers not to do silly things like *x =
On 2011/11/18 11:52:44, dsymonds wrote:
> I think from "In general, ..." to the end of this paragraph could be deleted. I
> don't think the weekly notes need this level of editorialising or justification.

strongly agree

http://codereview.appspot.com/5416045/diff/1/doc/devel/weekly.html#newcode60
doc/devel/weekly.html:60: * gc: better error , type checks, and many fixes,
s/ ,/,/
